resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: cancelToken and renewToken should use shortUserName consistently

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I am adding support to Storm Hive Bolt to access Hive meta-store using delegation tokens. I am able to create and cancel delegation tokens using HCatClient. I am getting below exception while renewing a delegation token.

Exception:
org.apache.hive.hcatalog.common.HCatException: org.apache.hive.hcatalog.common.HCatException : 9001 : Exception occurred while processing HCat request : MetaException while renewing delegation token.. Cause : MetaException(message:hive/test.cluster.com@EXAMPLE.COM tries to renew a token with renewer hive)
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.api.HCatClientHMSImpl.renewDelegationToken(HCatClientHMSImpl.java:643) ~[hive-webhcat-java-client-0.14.0.jar:0.14.0]
	

Hadoop's AbstractDelegationTokenIdentifier sets the renewer to Kerberos short name but HCatCleint.renewDelegationToken uses the fullName. This causes the renewal to fail.

Relevant parts of code: https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/shims/common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/thrift/DelegationTokenSecretManager.java#L96

https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/token/delegation/AbstractDelegationTokenIdentifier.java#L105


Let me know If I am missing something.
fields.summary: Exception while renewing a Delegation Token

comments.body: I am hitting this same issue and I think we should fix this. I will take a look at this.

I think is caused due to inconsistency in the renewToken method in hadoop-common. I have created a JIRA to get this fixed in hadoop. Meanwhile I will provide a patch for Hive to workaround this problem.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12899492 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

The change looks good to me. +1.

It does look like that hadoop has the inconsistency though.
Hi [~vgumashta] I see you have made some commits related to tokens/kerberos short-names in the past. I would appreciate if you could take a look at this patch as well. Thanks!

Implementation Note for future reference: 

UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser().getShortUserName() uses HadoopKerberosName.getShortName() so it should evaluate the shortname using the {{hadoop.security.auth_to_local}} rules when and if its configured for HS2 or HMS.

Patch committed to master and branch-2. Thanks for the review [~aihuaxu]
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
